definition: to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Whatever the explanation, it can be a very useful tool for a pickpocket.
sentences.chinese: 不管是什麼原因，這對扒手來說都是有用的手段。

sentences.english: Swift as Mercury, he has been named the King of pickpockets.
sentences.chinese: 動作靈活，他被譽爲扒手之王。

sentences.english: The pickpocket was caught in the act.
sentences.chinese: 那扒手在行竊時被當場逮住。

sentences.english: PICKPOCKET】Most pickpockets usually work in crowds of people.
sentences.chinese: 多數的扒手通常在人羣中動手。

sentences.english: Some light- fingered rogue has relieved him of his wallet.
sentences.chinese: 扒手將他的錢包偷走了。

sentences.english: We watched the pick-pocket being taken into the police office.
sentences.chinese: 我們看到那個扒手被帶進警察局。

sentences.english: We must be on our guard against pickpockets on a bus.
sentences.chinese: 在公交車上我們要小心扒手。

sentences.english: There are many pickpockets near the railway station.
Beware of pickpockets in crowded department stores.
sentences.chinese: 在人潮擁擠的百貨公司裏，要當心扒手。

sentences.english: The police have been instructed to keep an eye out for pick-pockets at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 已經指示警察密切注意集市上的扒手。

sentences.english: Dodger thinks Oliver is too green to be a good pickpocket.
sentences.chinese: 道奇認爲奧立佛還太青澀，去做一個好扒手。

sentences.english: The pickpocket relieved the fat passenger of all his money.
sentences.chinese: 扒手把那位胖旅客的錢全偷走了。

sentences.english: The streets abound with beggars and pickpockets.
sentences.chinese: 這些街上乞丐和扒手觸目皆是。

sentences.english: The pickpocket was haled into the police station.
Only called the attention of pickpockets, though I do not know who you are.
sentences.chinese: 只是有個叫扒手的注意點，雖然我不知道你是誰。

definition: insect that damages cereal crop seedlings/(lit. and fig.) vermin/a person harmful to the country and the people
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
pervert (esp. one who gropes women in public)
